item.title: Cross Reverie launches in 2026; demo in February
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Turn-based RPG resurfaces after nine years.

Cross Reverie, a turn-based RPG developed by Montreal-based Sinxsoft with a canceled Kickstarter campaign dating back to July 2015, has resurfaced for the first time in nine years with a Steam page confirming a 2026 release window, and a short trailer announcing a demo due out in February. A console release is planned to follow the PC release.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

A Japanese RPG-inspired title, Cross Reverie takes away from the genre’s greatest to provide a unique experience revolving around character development, tactical battles and replay value.

Story

An island shrouded in myths and legends, Talesford is home to the mystical ancients and divine being, The Dreamer. Every 100 years, the Island is host to an old ritual, The Trial of the Ancients where exceptional contestants from each of Xylera’s four nations are summoned to take part in trials that will test their mettle. Only those who prove themselves will gain the Dreamer’s favor and have the one wish they desire, fulfilled.

The Trial of Nightmare

But as they soon find out, this year’s trial will turn out to be unlike any other. As the eight combatants lay their hopes and dreams on the line, their worse nightmare becomes reality as an entity, known only as The Shadow, takes over and changes the rules of the game…

Key Features

  • Story revolving around eight characters with multiple replays and ending possibilities.
  • Strategical turn-based battle system with combination attacks, elemental weakness, finishers, and more.
  • Different playstyles made possible through unique character abilities, weapon skills, and stigma customization.
  • Top-down exploration of field maps and dungeons.

Watch the demo announcement trailer below.

item.title: Psyvariar 3 delayed to May 21
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

No longer due out on March 19.

Publishers SUCCESS Corporation and Red Art Games, and developers Red Art Studios and Banana Bytes have delayed shoot ’em up sequel Psyvariar 3 from its previously planned March 19 release date to May 21. It will be available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, Switch, and PC via Steam.

In a press release, SUCCESS Corporation said that, due to “various circumstances,” the game will require a bit more time for development and fine-tuning before it is ready for release.

Here is an overview of the game, via Red Art Games:

About

Psyvariar 3 takes place many years after the events of Psyvariar 2. After the fall of ETA, a faction of Psyvariars declared that Earth was too precious to be forsaken. They vowed to reclaim and colonize it once more, with GUIS rising from its ashes to resume its original mission.

Decades pass. The Earth colony thrives. Then… a signal. Alien. Unknown.

The moment Gluon particles are detected, dread spreads like fire. The skies darken with a familiar terror—Earth is under siege once again. The time has come for a new generation of Psyvariars to rise… and save humanity.

Key Features

  • Seven playable characters with unique shot types, buzz and bomb mechanics, and scoring systems.
  • Guest character Cotton from the Cotton series is fully playable with her own ship and abilities.
  • Refined Buzz system that rewards skillful bullet grazing with score boosts and shield chains.
  • Signature roll mechanic updated for modern controllers all the while preserving the original arcade “wiggle” input for extra advantage and fluid movement.
  • Neutrino and shield system that give access to shields, speed boosts, and enhanced weapons by buzzing and shooting.
  • Strategic bomb variations that include short and long types with varying effects depending on the character in use.
  • Multiple game modes: Arcade, Arrange, Mission (49 short challenges), Caravan, Endless, and Practice.
  • Dynamic difficulty selection that unlocks harder routes and exclusive boss encounters based on performance.
  • Seven distinct areas and bosses with varied attack patterns depending on the difficulty.
  • Arcade-perfect intensity that preserves the intense, high risk / high reward action the series is known for.
  • Neo-retro 3D aesthetics inspired by early Psyvariar games.

More About Psyvariar

Born in 2000 with the launch of the original Psyvariar: Medium Unit in Japanese Arcades, the Psvyariar series has since then made its mark over the years. Psyvariar 3 is the highly anticipated sequel to the acclaimed vertical shoot ’em up series.

Designed with deep reverence for the franchise by lovers of the genre, Psyvariar 3 is the result of the collaboration between Banana Bytes (Sophstar), Red Art Games, and Red Art Studios, with the blessing of intellectual property holder SUCCESS Corporation. It builds on the franchise’s signature “buzz” mechanic while introducing new characters, refined controls, and a variety of game modes. With its seven unique pilots, each with distinct abilities and scoring systems, it also remains faithful to its arcade roots while delivering enhanced replay value and accessibility for today’s players.

Watch an updated trailer below.

item.title: Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road sales top 800,000; second major update launches January 28
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

New update adds Ares Route opening and other features.

Total sales for “hyperdimensional football RPG” Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road have surpassed 800,000 units, developer LEVEL-5 announced. A second free major update will launch on January 28, adding the Ares Route opening and other features, following its first free major update “Galaxy & LBX DLC” that launched in December 2025.

Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road launched as a digital-only title for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam on November 13 worldwide. Advanced access for pre-orders on PlayStation, Xbox Series, and PC began on November 10. Sales surpassed 500,000 units one week after release.

Here are the latest details, via LEVEL-5:

Worldwide Digital Sales Exceed 800,000 Copies

Released worldwide as a digital-only title on November 14, 2025 (JST), Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road has now surpassed 800,000 copies sold as of January 13, 2026 (JST).

This title’s endless Hyperdimensional Football RPG experience can be enjoyed through Story Mode, set 25 years after the original Inazuma Eleven game; Chronicle Mode, where players can relive the entire history of the series; and Kizuna Station, where they build their town and interact with friends online.

In December 2025, one month after launch, we released the first free major update, the “Galaxy & LBX DLC,” adding new routes to Chronicle Mode and introducing a new rarity to deepen team development.

The second free major update is scheduled for January 28 (JST) and will include the opening of the Ares Route, among other features.

We will continue to provide free content over the long term, including additional route expansion and the official tournament system, Victory Road.

Please stay tuned.

Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road—The Latest Installment in the Series

In the latest entry in the Inazuma Eleven series, Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road, Story Mode follows a new protagonist, Destin Billows (Unmei Sasanami), on an all-new adventure.

In addition, Chronicle Mode allows players to scout over 5,400 characters from both past and present titles, while the online tournament mode, Victory Road, lets players compete against others from around the world.

item.title: ANTHEM#9 launches February 5
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Gem-matching roguelite game dated.

Gem-matching roguelite game ANTHEM#9 will launch for PC via Steam on February 5 for 2,200 yen, publisher Shueisha Games and developer koeda announced. It will support English, Japanese, Korean, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language options.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Combine gems to form combos! In the strategic gem match roguelite ANTHEM#9, you’ll fight thrilling and puzzle-like combo battles. Assume the role of an agent of the secret organization known as ANTHEM#9 and confront powerful foes! Strategic deck construction is the key to unleashing lots of combos.

Match Three Colors of Gems to Form Massive Combos!

Match gems to activate skills and destroy foes with a flurry of combos!

Creating a deck that unleashes maximum damage and triggers high-speed combos within a limited time window is the key to victory.

ANTHEM#9 delivers strategic depth and a kinetic rush as a Gem-Match roguelite experience that’s both cerebral and thrilling.

Higher the Combo, the Greater the Thrill of Battle!

Match three colors of gems like in a match-three puzzle style game to activate powerful skills. Chain combos to ramp up damage—and satisfaction.

Choose the optimal order to trigger explosive sequences and crush bosses with style!

Trust Your Instincts and Aim for the Ultimate Deck!

In randomly generated dungeons, collect Attack Skills and “Blessings,” and build your deck that tips the scale of battle in your favor..

Customize which colored gems your skills require, fine-tune your strategy, and take down formidable foes as you climb deeper into the dungeon.

Setting

ANTHEM#9 is an international secret organization that seeks to maintain global stability through balance and harmony. Play as an agent of ANTHEM#9 and purge those who threaten the world’s balance.

Characters

  • Rubit – Our protagonist. An agent of ANTHEM#9. Her cunning combat style utilizes a dagger and poison skills. Rubit’s specialty lies in adaptability—by spending AP, she can change the color of her gems on the fly. Even when the board isn’t in her favor, she can recover from tight situations and keep the combos flowing.
  • Phannie – A hedonistic gambler. Uses a gun for his flashy and bold fighting style. He can spend AP to split double gems. Increasing his total gems synergizes perfectly with skills that trigger multiple times! With a high-risk high-reward approach, he can unleash massive combos that no other character could!
  • Beni – A martial artist who fights for the pride of her people. She’s a self-proclaimed hero! She can use AP to consume gems in exchange for Shield, healing, Attack buffs, and more. Her fighting style involves packing a lot into a single hit, and she can stack buffs to accomplish that or to give herself ironclad defense. Swearing to punish evil, she uses her overwhelming power to pursue justice!

About the Creator

A game creator who began working in 2021.

Has no experience in the industry and isn’t a programmer. But unable to give up on his dreams of game development, he picked up a beginner’s guide past the age of thirty and worked tirelessly. He didn’t know left from right, but he had the passion to keep going. He was also proactive about presenting at events.

His debut game, ANTHEM#9, received the grand prize in the Shueisha Game Creators Camp Game BBQ Vol. 2 No Demo Division.

item.title: ARC Raiders sales top 12 million
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

"Gilded Pickaxe" Raider Tool now available for a limited time.

Total sales for player-versus-player-versus-environment survival extraction shooter ARC Raiders have surpassed 12.4 million units, developer Embark Studios announced. The game also achieved a record high of 960,000 concurrent players in January.

ARC Raiders launched for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store on October 30, 2025, and surpassed four million sales in under two weeks.

“Reaching 12 million downloads is a milestone we owe entirely to the players,” said executive producer Aleksander Grondal in a press release. “The community of Raiders has helped shape this game from the very beginning, and their passion, feedback, and ingenuity continue to guide how we build, support, and grow this world for the long term.”

To celebrate the milestone, Embark Studios is offering the “Gilded Pickaxe” Raider Tool as a free-in-game reward for a limited time.

Ongoing updates for ARC Raiders will continue to “refine systems, strengthen the game’s foundation, and ensure the experience remains challenging, competitive, and rewarding for Raiders.” More information on future updates and new content will be announced in the months ahead.

item.title: Thief’s Roulette launches January 24
item.content:encoded:
• PC

First-person puzzle adventure game dated.

First-person puzzle adventure game Thief’s Roulette will launch for PC via Steam on January 24, developer hirogame announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Lady Luck has chosen 15 “thieves” to compete in Thief’s Roulette. A new world of puzzles and deception.

Story

You arrive in a strange place surrounded by unfamiliar faces. You and 14 others are made to compete in a series of challenges, hosted by a mysterious woman called Lady Luck. What is the goal of this ordeal? Why do you feel like merely an observer?

Lady Luck proclaims these 15 strangers to be “thieves,” and for that reason, she has brought them here to fight for their lives. To survive they must complete all of Lady Luck’s Challenges. Unravel the truth of Lady Luck’s game, and find your way out of this strange new world.

Gameplay

Thief’s Roulette is a first-person puzzle adventure game with a cryptic story to unravel. At the core of the game are a series of challenges conducted by Lady Luck. You will face a large variety of puzzles and obstacles as you make your way to the truth. Thief’s Roulette is not a traditional visual novel, but does feature visual novel-style cutscenes and conversations.

Key Features

  • A story of secrets and deception.
  • Unique and dynamic puzzles to solve.
  • First-person gameplay with fully explorable 3D escape rooms.
